The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include new credits for flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicles and qualified alternative fuel motor vehicles. The new flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicle credit is determined under subsection (e) and the new qualified alternative fuel motor vehicle credit is determined under subsection (f). The credit amount for a new hybrid flexible fuel motor vehicle placed in service by the taxpayer during the taxable year is determined under paragraph (2) of subsection (e). The credit amount for a new hybrid flexible fuel motor vehicle placed in service by the taxpayer during the taxable year is determined under paragraph (2) of subsection (e). The credit amount for a new hybrid flexible fuel motor vehicle is determined based on the city fuel economy percentage compared to a comparable vehicle, ranging from $1,500 to $3,500. The city fuel economy of a new flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicle is determined on an E-85 ethanol gallon equivalent basis, while the comparable vehicle is determined on a gasoline gallon equivalent basis. The new hybrid vehicle must be capable of operating on alternative fuel, gasoline, or any blend, and achieve a city fuel economy using E-85 ethanol of at least 125. The text discusses the certification requirements for a new flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicle to qualify for a city fuel economy credit. It also extends the termination date for this credit until December 31, 2014. Additionally, it specifies that the vehicle must achieve a city fuel economy using E-85 ethanol that is at least 125% of a comparable nonhybrid vehicle fueled by gasoline. The text discusses amendments to the numeric limitation for vehicles included in the city fuel economy credit, specifically for new flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicles. Amendments include changes to subsections (i)(5) and (i)(6) of section 30B of the Code. The amendments made in the text apply to new flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicles and include changes to subsections of the Code. The effective date for these amendments is after December 31, 2006.
